name: DIA for Guest Access on top of IWAN

var.description: The LAN interface on which direct Internet access will be served
The VLAN on the LAN on which direct internet access will be served
The IPv4 address of the LAN interface on which direct internet access will be served.
The IPv4 subnet mask of the LAN interface on which direct internet access will be served. If you are using a second router, this will be one of two HSRP addresses.
The IPv4 HSRP address of the LAN that will act as default gateway.
The HSRP priority of the LAN interface. For the primary router, use 110. For the secondary router, use 105.
The WAN interface on which the Internet is connected.
The IPv4 address of the WAN interface on which the Internet is connected.
The IPv4 LAN subnet on which DIA is served. This should align with DIA_LAN_IPV4_ADDRESS and DIA_LAN_SUBNET_MASK.
The IPv4 LAN subnet mask on which DIA is served. This should align with DIA_LAN_IPV4_ADDRESS and DIA_LAN_SUBNET_MASK.

description: Direct Internet Access for Guests allows Internet connected branches to send traffic directly to the Internet, rather than back to HQ, for a specific portion of traffic. In this case, the configuration enables a location to provision a seperate network, NAT the subnet to the Internet, and ensure that the subnet can't reach any of the other LAN side networks.!!! Usage: clean
